24 Great Alternative Christmas Songs

Plenty of people despise Christmas music. I, for my sins, am not one of them. I’m a real sucker for a good bit of seasonal merriment,  and it seems so are a lot of you. My Christmas posts are always popular, so last year I treated you all to an advent-style rundown of some of my favourite ‘alternative’ Christmas classics. For those of you who missed it last year, or who merely want a handy refresher, here’s that list in a handy condensed form.

I’m sure that this won’t be my last cashing-in-on-holiday-fever post, but I doubt I’ll do a full scale count down like last year. While I love Christmas songs dearly, and there seem to be a awful lot of them out there, the number of them that are actually good is sadly finite. Last year I claimed that these were the best ones out there and while one or two new hits may emerge this year, there certainly won’t be enough good ones to justify another list of this scale. So, without further ado, here’s twenty four of the best alternative Christmas songs out there:

Master Slash Slave - All I Want For Christmas [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/MasterSlashSlave_AllIWantForChristmas.mp3]

Jimmy Eat World - 12.23.95

Get Well Soon - Christmas in Adventure Parks

Eels - Everything’s Gonna Be Cool This Christmas

Christopher Dennis - The Christmas Sandwich [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/ChristopherDennis_TheChristmasSandwich.mp3]

Sonic Youth - Santa Doesn’t Cop Out On Dope

Run-D.M.C. - Christmas In Hollis [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/RunDMC_ChristmasInHollis.mp3]

Mogwai - Christmas Song

Lightspeed Champion - Another Song About Being Alone At Xmas

Sufjan Stevens - That Was The Worst Christmas Ever!

Pictures of Then - I Believe in Father Christmas [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/PicturesOfThen_IBelieveInFatherChristmas.mp3]

Banjo or Freakout - White Christmas

Branches - O Come All Ye Faithful

The Decemberists - Please Daddy (Don’t Get Drunk This Christmas)

They Might Be Giants - Santa’s Beard

Casiotone For The Painfully Alone - Cold White Christmas

Piney Gir - Christmas Time [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/PineyGir_ChristmasTime.mp3]

Spiers & Boden - On Christmas Day

All the songs on this list are at worst seasonally entertaining, and often pretty good regardless of the time of year, but the select few that follow have risen to a higher level. One benefit of a good Christmas song is that it is infinitely re-usable. At the core of this phenomenon is that at this time of year we’re far more willing to be generous to songs that would, in other circumstances, sound dated or trashy. We’ll throw caution and taste to the wind precisely because we know they’ll be safely locked away again come december 24th. This next selection of songs, however, I wish I could listen to all year round (although, of course, I can’t). The Withered Hand offering, in particular, represents the peak of an exceptional career.

The Winter Sounds - The Anthem Is A Gift [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/TheWinterSounds_TheAnthemIsAGift.mp3]

Lindley Ruth and Her Tipsy String Band feat. Jordan Hull - Merry Christmas From The Family [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/LindleyRuth_MerryChristmasFromTheFamily.mp3]

Jim White - Christmas Day [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/JimWhite_ChristmasDay.mp3]

Frightened Rabbit - It’s Christmas So We’ll Stop [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/FrightenedRabbit_ItsChristmasSoWellStop.mp3]

Withered Hand - It’s A Wonderful Lie [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/WitheredHand_ItsAWonderfulLie.mp3]

The Very Foundation - All Lit Up (For Christmas) [audio http://www.bearfacedrecords.com/EbMBlog_mp3s/Christmas/TheVeryFoundation_AllLitUp.mp3]

Written by Tom on the 26th November, 2012.
